# Task #87 - Richer Loading Indicators - Completion Report
**Status**: COMPLETE
**Generated By**: Test-and-Cleanup Agent (combined workflow)
**Date**: 2025-12-17

## Executive Summary
Implemented skeleton loaders and spinner components for loading states across the frontend application. This enhancement improves user experience by providing visual feedback during data loading operations, replacing plain "Loading..." text with animated skeletons and spinners that match the actual page layouts.

## What Was Accomplished

### Files Created (4 files)
1. **`frontend/src/components/ui/skeleton.tsx`**
   - Base Skeleton component following shadcn/ui pattern
   - Uses `animate-pulse` and `bg-muted` classes for visual feedback

2. **`frontend/src/components/skeletons/DetailPageSkeleton.tsx`**
   - Type-specific skeleton layouts for project, contact, and organization detail pages
   - Matches actual page structure for smooth visual transitions

3. **`frontend/src/components/skeletons/DashboardSkeleton.tsx`**
   - `DashboardStatsSkeleton` - 4 stat cards with pulse animation
   - `RecentProjectsSkeleton` - 5 project item skeletons

4. **`frontend/src/components/skeletons/index.ts`**
   - Barrel export file for skeleton components

## Implementation Details

### Skeleton Component Pattern
The base `Skeleton` component follows the shadcn/ui pattern:
```tsx
<div className={cn("animate-pulse rounded-md bg-muted", className)} {...props} />
```

### Loading State Pattern
Consistent pattern across list pages using `Loader2` spinner:
```tsx
<div className="flex items-center justify-center py-8">
  <Loader2 className="h-8 w-8 animate-spin text-muted-foreground" />
  <span className="ml-2 text-muted-foreground">Loading [items]...</span>
</div>
```

### Detail Page Skeleton Types
- `project`: 3-column layout with description and metadata cards
- `contact`: Stats card, info card, and projects table skeleton
- `organization`: Stats cards, projects table, and contacts table skeleton
